content:
Hey @T-libs,

There are quite a few T-libs issues open that are marked as a regression that might be outdated/already fixed. Many have been open for several years. If anyone has time: it'd be good to go over them and check which ones are still relevant:

- [31407] P-medium Float parsing can fail on valid float literals
- [44048] P-low Support all formatting flags in \`std::path::Display\`
- [47321] P-low Performance regression on nightly (when using Cursor::read\_exact and Byteorder)
- [53340] Performance regression in tight loop since rust 1.25
- [53823] P-medium Binary search performance regressed in 1.25
- [60375] P-high Regression: Typemap type mismatch in 1.34.0+
- [62439] 1.65x performance regression from 1.35.0 to 1.36.0
- [67599] P-medium Backtrace is \<unknown\> for dynamic library loaded through dlopen using absolute file path for rust \>= 1.37.0 on OSX
- [71359] P-medium Regression in usable type complexity: overflow representing the type \`...\`
- [73030] P-high \[stable regression\] #\[should\_panic\] tests segfault in certain OS X configurations with 1.44.0
- [78713] P-medium regression: \`panic!\` and RUST\_BACKTRACE=1 Show Wrong & Non\-Informative Function Names when Unwinding
- [80804] P-high 1.49 seems to have bumped required macOS version
- [83528] P-low Writing to \`stdout\` with \`write()\` changed behavior between version 1.47 and \>= 1.48
#80804 hasn't been fixed, though #85953 is open for it.
It might be a good idea for y'all to assign a libs team member to each P-high issue? I know the compiler team does that.
I went over a fair number of these and left comments
#47321 is fixed for examples provided by the reporter, I asked a me-too commenter whether it's still an issue for him.
#83528 would be fixed by #78515 but the PR has rotted due to the slow reviews/merge conflict/busy author vicious circle. The PR has been pinged recently, let's see if we get an update.
